meanings.definition: To subject to the action of an opiate.
meanings.sent1: The doctor was opiating the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent2: She opiated her mind with the calming effects of the medication.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be opiating itself with the warm sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The music had a way of opiating his senses, transporting him to another world.
meanings.sent5: The scent of lavender was opiating, lulling her into a peaceful slumber.

meanings.definition: To induce a state of calm or sleepiness by administering an opiate.
meanings.sent1: The nurse was opiating the anxious patient before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The medication quickly opiated her, and she drifted off to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The cozy blanket seemed to be opiating her into a nap.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain opiated the town, creating a serene atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The soothing voice of the narrator was opiating, easing all worries.

meanings.definition: Having the properties of an opiate.
meanings.sent1: The opiating effects of the medication were evident in his drowsy expression.
meanings.sent2: She felt the opiating influence of the drug slowly taking over.
meanings.sent3: The opiating blanket seemed to wrap her in a cocoon of comfort.
meanings.sent4: The opiating aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The opiating warmth of the fireplace was inviting on a cold night.
